mdRecord.dcterms:title: The sinking of the pirate Alabama by the U.S. Gunboat "Kearsarge," Captain Winslow, June 19th, 1864 / Written by Silas S. Steele, Esq. ; Tune: "Teddy the Tiler," or "Cannibal Islands."
I sing the doom and dark career
Pirate Alabama
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Steele, Silas Sexton. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in 5 verses with 4 choruses; without music; printed in blue in 2 columns on illustrated letter paper, with verso of sheet ruled in blue. [original]
First line: I sing the doom and dark career. [original]
Hand-colored headpiece of the sinking of the ship, Magnus 98. Cf. American song sheets, 2120d. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Seventh of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Alabama (Screw sloop)--Songs and music--Texts
